snippet: Jihad Makdissi, the former Foreign Ministry spokesman, has resurfaced, a rare high-profile dissenter seeking to position himself as a voice for many Syrians who remain on the sidelines.
abstract: Jihad Makdissi, former spokesman for Syria's Foreign Ministry who resigned and fled country in 2012, seeks to position himself as voice for broad center of Syrian society that fears extremism within rebellion but still believes it was rooted in valid political demands.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HALA DROUBI

lead_paragraph: Jihad Makdissi, the former Foreign Ministry spokesman, has resurfaced, a rare high-profile dissenter seeking to position himself as a voice for many Syrians who remain on the sidelines.

headline.main: Ex-Official Claims to Speak for Sidelined Syrians
headline.print_headline: Ex-Official Claims to Speak for Sidelined Syrians

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
